content.value: A decentralized, stable and non pegged currency made for the digital economy
Deposit your crypto assets, generate RAI and lever up your position
Trade RAI and take advantage of its repricing mechanism
Monitor the protocol so you can better manage your positions

RAI is a non pegged, ETH backed stable asset. It is useful as more "stable" collateral for other DeFi protocols (compared to ETH or BTC) or as a stable asset with an embedded interest rate that supercharges other DeFi protocols.
Whether you want to take advantage of RAI’s repricing mechanism or build an insurance protocol on top of it, our docs are here to help.

Reflexer is a platform where anyone can use their crypto collateral to issue reflex indexes. Reflex indexes are stable assets that are not pegged to anything, very similar to how the US Dollar is not pegged and it is still considered stable.

No. Stablecoins are pegged or oscillating around a specific value (usually pegged to fiat coins such as USD, EUR etc). RAI, on the other hand, is not pegged to anything. The system behind RAI only cares about the market price getting as close as possible to the redemption price. The redemption price will almost always float (thus, it won't be pegged) in order to compel system participants to bring the market price toward it.

node.title: What are the redemption price and the market price?

content.value: The redemption price is what the protocol wants RAI's market price to be. The market price is the price that RAI is actually trading at on exchanges. Think of the redemption price as a moving target that the market price is always supposed to chase.

The Reflexer app and website are free to use. However, you will need to pay transaction fees when you interact with the protocol’s smart contracts and, depending on the features you use, fees associated with RAI itself such as the Stability Fee and, indirectly, the Redemption Rate.
